info.title: Platform
info.description:
# REST API Concepts

Solace PubSub+ Platform provides RESTful APIs that you can use to manage your data in PubSub+ Cloud. The REST APIs allow
you to model your event-driven architectures from your own client applications.

The following document describes the public REST APIs available for use. Please note that these APIs are in the Early
Access release stage and are available for testing and early user feedback. The APIs are subject to change until they
are declared Generally Available.

servers.description: Solace PubSub+ Cloud US EAST Region

get.summary: (Beta) Get the role- and resource-based assignments
get.description:
Get the role- and resource-based assignments in the account (organization).

Token Permissions: [ iam_user_rrbac_attribute_assignments:get ]

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the resource

schema.description: The unique identifier for the resource

parameters.name: resourceType
parameters.description:
The type of resource to assign.
- 'application_domain' : A logical area within Event Portal where organizations create and manage objects that represent the components of your event-driven architecture.
- 'event_broker_service' : An event broker service within Mission Control Cluster Manager.
- 'environment' : An environment within Event Portal.<Review>

schema.description:
The type of resource to assign.
- 'application_domain' : A logical area within Event Portal where organizations create and manage objects that represent the components of your event-driven architecture.
- 'event_broker_service' : An event broker service within Mission Control Cluster Manager.
- 'environment' : An environment within Event Portal.<Review>

example.message: You do not have permissions to perform this operation.

put.summary: (Beta) Add or replace the role and resource assignments
put.description: Add or replace the role and resource assignments.

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the resource

schema.description: The unique identifier for the resource

parameters.name: resourceType
parameters.description:
The type of resource to assign.
- 'application_domain' : A logical area within Event Portal where organizations create and manage objects that represent the components of your event-driven architecture.

example.message: You do not have permissions to perform this operation.

get.description:
Get a list of all environments.

Token Permissions: [ environments:view ]

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of environments to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the environment to match on.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The query (fieldName:<ASC/DESC>) used to sort the environment list in the response

example.message: You do not have permissions to perform this operation.
You do not have permissions to perform this operation.

get.description:
Get an environment using its unique identifier.

Token Permissions: [ environments:view ]

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the environment

example.message: You do not have permissions to perform this operation.

put.description:
Update an environment's attributes using the environment's unique identifier.

Token Permissions: [ environments:edit ]

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the environment

example.message: You do not have permissions to perform this operation.

delete.description:
Delete an environment using its unique identifier. The default environment cannot be deleted.

Token Permissions: [ environments:edit ]

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the environment

400.description: Unable to delete the last environment

example.message: You do not have permissions to perform this operation.

patch.description:
Modify an environment's attributes using the environment's unique identifier.

Token Permissions: [ environments:edit ]

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the environment

example.message: You do not have permissions to perform this operation.

get.description:
Retrieves the contact list from a single organization. If you have an account that has multiple organizations, you would retrieve the contact list from the organization where you created the API token.

Token Permissions: [ iam_user:get ]

parameters.name: contactType
parameters.description:
The type of contact to filter by. The allowed contact types are:
  • `EXTERNAL_ALERTS`-The contacts for operational alerts, such as event broker outages or issues with the platform.
  • `EXTERNAL_NOTIFICATIONS`-The contacts for operational notifications about the platform, such as event broker upgrades, upcoming deprecation notices, and event broker update announcements.

example.message: You do not have permissions to perform this operation.

put.description:
Update a customer's organization contacts by contact type. The new list will replace the organization's contact list for the selected contact type.

Token Permissions: [ console_org_contacts:put ]

parameters.name: contactType
parameters.description:
The type of contact list to update. The allowed contact types are:
  • `EXTERNAL_ALERTS`-The contacts for operational alerts, such as event broker outages or issues with the platform.
  • `EXTERNAL_NOTIFICATIONS`-The contacts for operational notifications about the platform, such as event broker upgrades, upcoming deprecation notices, and event broker update announcements.

example.message: You do not have permissions to perform this operation.

get.description:
Get the list of the roles available in the account (organization).

Token Permissions: [ iam_org_roles:get ]

example.message: You do not have permissions to perform this operation.

get.description:
Get the claim to user group mappings (or claim mappings).

Token Permissions: [ iam_claim_mapping:read ]

example.message: You do not have permissions to perform this operation.

put.summary: (Beta) Add or replace the claim mappings
put.description:
Add or replace the claim mappings.

Token Permissions: [ iam_claim_mapping:write ]

example.message: You do not have permissions to perform this operation.

get.summary: (Beta) Get a list of user groups
get.description:
Get the list of the user groups.

Token Permissions: [ iam_user_group:read ]

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of user groups to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of user group.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The query (fieldName:<asc/desc>) used to sort the list in the response.

example.message: You do not have permissions to perform this operation.

post.description:
Create a user group. You can assign roles when creating the user group. Users who belong to the user group inherit the group's assigned roles and entitlements.

Token Permissions: [ iam_user_group:write ]

example.message: You do not have permissions to perform this operation.

get.summary: (Beta) Get a specific user group by identifier
get.description:
Get the details of a user group using its unique identifier.

Token Permissions: [ iam_user_group:read ]

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user group.

example.message: You do not have permissions to perform this operation.

put.description:
Update an existing user group.

Token Permissions: [ iam_user_group:write ]

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user group.

example.message: You do not have permissions to perform this operation.

delete.summary: (Beta) Delete a specific user group by identifier
delete.description:
Delete a user group using its unique identifier.

Token Permissions: [ iam_user_group:write ]

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user group.

example.message: You do not have permissions to perform this operation.

get.summary: (Beta) Get a list of users in your account
get.description:
Get a list of users. You can retrieve a list of users matching on email, name, identifiers, or roles.

Token Permissions: [ iam_users:get ]

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of users to return on each page.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the user. You can enter a partial string into the field to match multiple users.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email address of the user. You can enter a partial string into the field to match multiple users.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The list of unique identifiers for users.

parameters.name: roles
parameters.description: The unique identifiers of the roles that are assigned to the user.

parameters.name: groups
parameters.description: The unique identifiers of the groups that are assigned to the user.

example.message: You do not have permissions to perform this operation.

message.description: A user-friendly message that describes the error.

errorId.description: The UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) that is logged with an appropriate stack trace for a WARN or ERROR log that allows support to better determine what cause the error.

meta.description: The metadata about the error. This provides additional information about the error that occurred.

validationDetails.description: When applicable, these are the details of issues with the fields provided for the REST call.

name.description: The name of the user group.

description.description: A description of the user group.
description.example: This group can modify event broker services and event meshes.

roles.description: A collection of unique identifiers representing the roles assigned to the user group.

id.description: The unique identifier for the user group.

organizationId.description: The unique identifier for the account (organization).

name.description: The name of the user group.

description.description: A description of the user group.

roles.description: A collection of unique identifiers representing the roles assigned to the user group.

meta.description:
The metadata about the response, which can include:

  • Pagination data, such as page number, page size, etc. for GET operations that return large amount of response data. For more information, see Pagination.
  • Timestamp information, such as current time, or the time create or update operation occurred for CREATE, PUT, POST operations.

claimKey.description: The claim key or name of the token issued by the identity provider (IdP).

claimValueToGroupsMapping.description: The claim mapping. A claim mapping is the value from the claim to the unique identifiers of the user groups.

justInTimeProvisioning.description: Indicates whether to allow Just-In-Time (JIT). The valid values are 'true' (enable) or 'false' (disable). The default is 'false'.

defaultGroupId.description: The unique identifier of the user group to assign to a user when user's claim doesn't match any of the claims in the account (organization).

state.description:
The state of the claim mapping. The following states are:
  • `enabled`- Use the claim mapping. Users that log in using SSO are mapped to specified roles.
  • `disabled`- To not use the claim mapping. Users that log in using SSO are not mapped to the specified roles.

claimKey.description: The claim key or name of the token issued by the identity provider (IdP).

claimValueToGroupsMapping.description: The claim mapping. A claim mapping is the value from the claim to the unique identifiers of the user groups.

justInTimeProvisioning.description: Indicates whether to allow Just-In-Time (JIT). The valid values are 'true' (enable) or 'false' (disable). The default is 'false'.

defaultGroupId.description: The unique identifier of the user group to assign to a user when user's claim doesn't match any of the claims in the account (organization).

state.description:
The state of the claim mapping. The following states are:
  • `enabled`- Use the claim mapping. Users that log in using SSO are mapped to specified roles.
  • `disabled`- To not use the claim mapping. Users that log in using SSO are not mapped to the specified roles.

The metadata about the response, which can include:

  • Pagination data, such as page number, page size, etc. for GET operations that return large amount of response data. For more information, see Pagination.
  • Timestamp information, such as current time, or the time create or update operation occurred for CREATE, PUT, POST operations.

userId.description:
The unique identifier for the user.

You cannot assign the 'event_broker_service' resource type to a userId object. You can only assign them to userGroupId objects in organizations with single sign-on enabled.

userGroupId.description: The unique identifier for the user group.

isDefault.description:
Indicates whether this is the organization’s default environment. The default value is false. The valid values are:
  • true: The environment is the default.
  • false: The environment is not default.

icon.description: Specify the name of the icon to use for the environment.

fgColor.description:
Specify the RGB hexadecimal color code for the environment's foreground.
You can use 6-digit (opaque) or 8-digit (alpha) hex color codes.

bgColor.description:
Specify the RGB hexadecimal color code for the environment's background.
You can use 6-digit (opaque) or 8-digit (alpha) hex color codes.

meta.description:
The metadata about the response, which can include:

  • Pagination data, such as page number, page size, etc. for GET operations that return large amount of response data. For more information, see Pagination.
  • Timestamp information, such as current time, or the time create or update operation occurred for CREATE, PUT, POST operations.

The metadata about the response, which can include:

  • Pagination data, such as page number, page size, etc. for GET operations that return large amount of response data. For more information, see Pagination.
  • Timestamp information, such as current time, or the time create or update operation occurred for CREATE, PUT, POST operations.

id.description: The unique identifier for the organization contact.

type.description: The type of object for informational purposes.

email.description: The email address of the organization contact.

contactType.description:
The type of notification that is sent to the contact's email. The allowed contact types are:
  • 'INTERNAL' - Internal notifications.
  • 'EXTERNAL_ALERTS'- External alerts.
  • 'EXTERNAL_NOTIFICATIONS'- External notifications.

isDefault.description:
Indicates whether this is the organization’s default environment. The default value is false. The valid values are:
  • true: The environment is the default.
  • false: The environment is not default.

isProduction.description:
Indicates whether this is an organization’s production environment. The default value is true. The valid values are:
  • true: The environment is a production environment.
  • false: The environment is not a production environment.

This is an immutable field. If an environment needs to be migrated, architecture can be migrated to a new environment with the desired environment type instead.

icon.description: Specify the name of the icon to use for the environment.

fgColor.description:
Specify the RGB hexadecimal color code for the environment's foreground.
You can use 6-digit (opaque) or 8-digit (alpha) hex color codes.

bgColor.description:
Specify the RGB hexadecimal color code for the environment's background.
You can use 6-digit (opaque) or 8-digit (alpha) hex color codes.

type.description: The type of object for informational purposes.

id.description: The unique identifier for the user.

organizationId.description: The unique identifier for the account (organization).

firstName.description: The first name of the user.

lastName.description: The last name of the user.

email.description: The email address of the user.

roles.description: The ids of the roles of the user.

groups.description: The names and ids of the groups of the user.

state.description:
The state of the user in the account (organization). The state includes:
  • 'NEVER_ACTIVATED'-The user was not activated.
  • 'INVITED'-The user was invited to join the account.
  • 'ACTIVE'-The user is active in the account.

  • Timestamp information, such as current time, or the time create or update operation occurred for CREATE, PUT, POST operations.

description.example: User has full access to Mission Control, Event Portal, Micro-Integrations, and account administrative functions (for example, user management).
